comment._content: Just because it is in the tags now does not mean it was when Lú posted. Anyone can add tags to these images. The Carrnania tag was added by Pixel Wrangler, but I don't know when. (Tags show authorship, but no dates, in API.) -- Seen on your photo stream. (?)

comment.author: 10741688@N06
comment._content: Carmania belonged to the Cunard Line.  She entered service in 1905 along with her near-identical sister Caronia.  Of the two, Carmania was equipped with turbines whilst Caronia had the standard engines, an experiment designed to determine how the upcoming Lusitania and Mauretania would be engined.  Carmania was the faster ship.  The experiment was a success and the new liners received turbine engines.  Carmania served as an Armed Merchant Cruiser in World War 1 and has the distinction of being the only liner to engage and sink another liner named Cap Trafalgar in a battle of Trinidad in September 1914.

comment.author: 67723960@N00
comment._content: My family came to America arriving in Boston in 1923 on the Carmania.
